qas.question: Even if a harvest is good, food security can be crippled when a government has tendencies toward what?

context: Governments with strong tendencies towards <a0_0>kleptocracy<a0_0/> can undermine food security even when harvests are good. Officials often steal state property. In Bihar, India, more than 80% of the subsidized food aid to poor is stolen by corrupt officials. Similarly, food aid is often robbed at gunpoint by governments, criminals, and warlords alike, and sold for a profit. The 20th century is full of many examples of governments undermining the food security of their own nations – sometimes intentionally.
